60度？

x = 60
Solution
As DCE = 20
so CD = BD
DE is the common side for triangle DCE and DBE
DCE = DBE = 20
Triangle DCE is congruent to triangle DBE
CDB = 10+70+60 (exterior angle) = 140
so EDB = EDC = 70
Let F be the intersection of DB and AE
AFB = 180-70-60 = 50
AFB = DFE = 50
x = 180 - DFE - EDF = 60

Using sine law,

3. Find FE and DF
Using cosine law,
4. Find DE
5. Find x

條題目原本係咁 http://thinkzone.wlonk.com/MathFun/Triangle.htm

Using only elementary geometry, determine angle x. Provide a step-by-step proof.

You may use only elementary geometry, such as the fact that the angles of a triangle add up to 180 degrees and the basic congruent triangle rules (side-angle-side, etc.). You may not use trigonomery, such as sines and cosines, the law of sines, the law of cosines, etc.

This is the hardest problem I have ever seen that is, in a sense, easy. It really can be done using only elementary geometry. This is not a trick question.

Remember to provide a step-by-step proof.
